title: 111_s1187
content: The "Local Homeland Event Response Operations Grant Act of 2009" authorizes grants for local homeland event response operations under Title XX of the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The "Local Homeland Event Response Operations Grant Act of 2009" defines an eligible entity as a law enforcement agency or fire department within 50 miles of a special event or participating in preparation for such events. The "Local Homeland Event Response Operations Grant Act of 2009" allows the Secretary to grant funds for overtime expenses related to special events designated by the President or Secretary as events of significant national importance. The "Local Homeland Event Response Operations Grant Act of 2009" allows for extensive Federal interagency security and incident management preparedness, predeployment of Federal assets, consultation and support to areas lacking expertise, designation of a Federal Coordinator, and development of an integrated Federal Support Plan. It may also require direct national-level Federal support, limited predeployment of assets, and situational awareness. The "Local Homeland Event Response Operations Grant Act of 2009" allows for Federal interagency security preparedness, predeployment of assets, consultation, support to areas lacking expertise, designation of a Federal Coordinator, and development of an integrated Federal Support Plan for special events of national significance. Eligible entities can apply for grants under this section. Eligible entities can jointly apply for grants for special events under this section. The Secretary will notify eligible entities of the opportunity to apply and provide necessary materials. Each special event requires a separate application for grant funding. Eligible entities can apply for grants for special events under this section. The application must include the purpose, budget, and description of the event. Grants can be used for salary, benefits, and necessary overtime for employees during special events. Eligible entities can apply for grants for special events under this section. Grants must be used to supplement, not supplant, funds of State or local governments. $25,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2010 to 2015 for this purpose. "Grants for local homeland event response operations are authorized under Subtitle C, with $25,000,000 allocated annually from 2010 to 2015."
